definition: to eat one's fill/to have a good meal
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]

sentences.english: There is so much litchi in Shenzhen. I can eat as many as I like.
sentences.chinese: 深圳的荔枝真多，我可以大飽口福了。

sentences.english: We hope you'll also get a feast for your appetite.
sentences.chinese: 也希望這淮揚菜能讓您大飽口福。

sentences.english: We feasted on chicken and coconuts.
sentences.chinese: 我們喫雞肉和椰子，大飽口福。

sentences.english: But I think it not only gluts my appetite.
sentences.chinese: 不過我覺得這些不光能讓人大飽口福。

sentences.english: It seems we'll have gourmet's luck today.
sentences.chinese: 看來我們今天真是可以大飽口福了。

definition: guests feel at home (in a hotel, guest house etc)/a home away from home
see 愛玉子|爱玉子[ai4 yu4 zi3]
ta-a noodles or danzai noodles, popular snack originating from Tainan
to eat one's fill/to be full
hot pot containing stinky tofu and other ingredients (Taiwanese dish)
